head.title: POSTINGS: On 34th St. Between 10th and 11th; High-Tech, Short-Term

identified-content.classifier: Office Buildings and Other Commercial Properties

hedline.hl1: POSTINGS: On 34th St. Between 10th and 11th; High-Tech, Short-Term

abstract.p: KickStart plans to open 45,000-square foot building on West 34th Street between 10th and 11th Avenues aimed at high-tech companies interested in short-term leases (S)

block.p: Three New York real estate companies will open a 45,000-square-foot building on the west side of Manhattan this week that is aimed at attracting high-tech companies interested in short-term commitments as tenants. The gutted and rebuilt six-story building, at 535 West 34th Street, between 10th and 11th Avenues, will offer 59 furnished office suites and will have available high-speed dedicated Internet services, conference rooms with video conferencing and on-site technical support.

KickStart, as the new company is known, said that tenants would be able to move into offices with multiple phone lines and high-speed DSL Internet service, for as little as three months. Rents start at $1,800 a month. The building's main floor is reserved for service providers specializing in Web design, accounting, public relations, human resources staffing and real estate.

Three New York real estate companies will open a 45,000-square-foot building on the west side of Manhattan this week that is aimed at attracting high-tech companies interested in short-term commitments as tenants. The gutted and rebuilt six-story building, at 535 West 34th Street, between 10th and 11th Avenues, will offer 59 furnished office suites and will have available high-speed dedicated Internet services, conference rooms with video conferencing and on-site technical support.

KickStart, as the new company is known, said that tenants would be able to move into offices with multiple phone lines and high-speed DSL Internet service, for as little as three months. Rents start at $1,800 a month. The building's main floor is reserved for service providers specializing in Web design, accounting, public relations, human resources staffing and real estate.

KickStart plans to open a second office building this December at 17 Battery Place, near Wall Street, and expects to add additional sites in major urban centers next year. KickStart's principals are Newmark and Company Real Estate, SavannaPartners and the Moinian Group.
